# The `PopulateLoopsDFS` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Populate all loop data in a stable order during a single forward DFS. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Protected Member Functions

### insertIntoLoop() {#ac3d14bf8a797b33e7100f3dd8b905acf}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class BlockT, class LoopT&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void llvm::PopulateLoopsDFS&lt; BlockT, LoopT &gt;::insertIntoLoop (BlockT &#42; Block)</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Add a single Block to its ancestor loops in PostOrder.

If the block is a subloop header, add the subloop to its parent in PostOrder, then reverse the Block and Subloop vectors of the now complete subloop to achieve RPO.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/genericloopinfoimpl-h/#l00526">526</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/genericloopinfoimpl-h">GenericLoopInfoImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
